intro: Sisymbrium dianthoides, commonly known as the sweet rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has pinnately divided leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Sisymbrium dianthoides is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas.
